ai.summary: This 9 km moderate hike starts at Chelwood Vachery and travels through Ashdown Forest, offering a mix of woodland paths, gentle climbs, and open glades. The route is suitable for hikers with basic fitness, with opportunities to spot wildlife and enjoy the forest scenery; expect varied surfaces and, after rain, some sticky or muddy sections.
ai.terrain_summary: Trail surfaces include packed dirt, gravel tracks, and sections with tree roots. Expect some gentle ascents and descents, shaded woodland in parts, and open heath areas. Ground can be uneven and muddy in wet conditions, so sturdy footwear and careful footing are advised.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked paths and carry a map and compass or GPS. Wear sturdy footwear and appropriate clothing, and check the weather forecast before setting out. Bring sufficient water and snacks, and inform someone of your planned route and expected return time. Be aware of ticks in forested areas and perform a quick check after the hike. Mobile signal may be limited in parts of the forest; have a means of signaling for help if needed.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Small first aid kit and whistle
Emergency blanket and headlamp or flashlight
ai.best_seasons: Spring to early autumn; particularly pleasant in late spring for wildflowers and in autumn for color. Winter hikes are possible but can be very muddy and conditions may be less favorable.

seo.title: Chelwood Vachery to Ashdown Forest – 9 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore a 9 km moderate hike from Chelwood Vachery through Ashdown Forest. Get terrain details, safety tips, and gear suggestions for this UK walk.
